job_description: Jr. Business Analyst & Test Case Writer - job post Berkley 20 reviews Irving, TX $54,782 - $125,948 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $54,782 - $125,948 a year Job Type Full-time At Berkley Entertainment, our team’s industry experience and collaborative approach leads to great client solutions — and this is by design. We are here to assist with customizing products and services that are tailored to respond to each client’s unique exposures. Our business model is focused on you and providing peace of mind — the way we operate, the team we have built, current and planned future products, and the way we interact with clients — will meet or exceed your expectations. The company is an equal opportunity employer. Responsibilities The Business Analyst will partner between IT and the business teams to provide software application support related to business analysis, data analysis, quality assurance testing, and help desk support related to a variety of software applications. Review, analyze and evaluate user requests, coordinate and monitor requests to a successful resolution. Document business requirements for small to medium system requests and test plans/test cases for all projects. Key Functions will include but not be limited to: Work with the customer community (Internal and External) and software development teams to deliver functional requirements and testing of user interfaces and data sources. Monitor, audit and analyze activity in business data processing systems for proper data input, coding and interchange of data feeds between disparate source systems. Identify, monitor, track and resolve production related system errors. Elicit requirements using discussions, document analysis, use cases, scenarios, and workflow analysis on small to medium projects. Define and execute test plans on all projects Review data in complex formats. Participate on project teams, understanding project plans, roles, goals and timelines. Qualifications Associates degree or equivalent work experience. 2 to 5 years of related IT experience. Working knowledge for Commercial Insurance. Demonstrate good judgment in what and how to communicate with a variety of clients and achieve results (strong sense of customer service). Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills, preparing written business requirements and test plans that are grammatically correct. Demonstrate organizational skills while working on multiple project initiatives. Demonstrate ability to work effectively with individuals throughout the organization. Exhibit objectivity and openness to others views and contributes to a positive team spirit. Ability to seek guidance or input from mentors and supervisors. Additional Company Details We do not accept any unsolicited resumes from external recruiting agencies. The company offers a competitive compensation plan and robust benefits package for full time regular employees. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $54,781.96 - $125,947.52 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Parental leave Professional development assistance Vision insurance Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday Work Location: In person Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Quality Assurance Analyst - job post CorVel Corporation 683 reviews Dallas, TX 75231 • Remote $56,860 - $129,456 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $56,860 - $129,456 a year Job Type Full-time The Quality Assurance Analyst will participate in assigned activities pertaining to planning, coordination, execution and reporting of all test initiatives undertaken to validate the proprietary software applications developed by our Engineering teams. Team responsibilities include: functional testing, regression testing, integration testing, and post release validation. To successfully accomplish these responsibilities, the QA Analyst will work closely with business units and subject matter experts to prepare and execute test cases, manage test data, and identify expected results. Part of the team is based in Portland, OR and part of the team is remote. This position may work from anywhere in the US. Major responsibilities include: Create, execute and maintain test cases for new and changing functionality. Create complex SQL scripts from scratch, in order to manipulate and validate data. Responsible for baseline testing, regression testing, functional/integration testing, and post release validation of application modules as assigned. Rapid testing responses to fixed defects. Identify, document, and communicate defects discovered during testing. Work closely with development team and other QA team members to analyze functionality and to help identify, analyze, and resolve issues. Produce quality products under tight and strict deadlines. Work with Test Automation team to identify and create test cases that will be automated. Required: 3+ years of experience testing applications creating test plans and test cases, executing test cases and managing defects. Strong experience with QA methodologies, software testing techniques and tools, especially for web-based software products. Proven ability to write complex SQL queries from scratch. Experience generating SQL queries including SQL scripts to create or validate testing data - demonstrating a high level of competence and ability. 3+ years’ experience and thorough understanding of relational database design, maintenance, and testing. Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical personnel. Demonstrated analytic, problem solving skills, and technical/non-technical leadership abilities. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent work experience. Bonus Points: Experience with Azure DevOps. Health industry & insurance billing experience. PAY RANGE: CorVel uses a market based approach to pay and our salary ranges may vary depending on your location. Pay rates are established taking into account the following factors: federal, state, and local minimum wage requirements, the geographic location differential, job-related skills, experience, qualifications, internal employee equity, and market conditions. Our ranges may be modified at any time. Pay Range: $56,860 - $129,456 A list of our benefit offerings can be found on our CorVel website: CorVel Careers | Opportunities in Risk Management About CorVel CorVel, a certified Great Place to Work® Company, is a national provider of industry-leading risk management solutions for the workers’ compensation, auto, health and disability management industries. CorVel was founded in 1987 and has been publicly traded on the NASDAQ stock exchange since 1991. Our continual investment in human capital and technology enable us to deliver the most innovative and integrated solutions to our clients. We are a stable and growing company with a strong, supportive culture and plenty of career advancement opportunities. Over 4,000 people working across the United States embrace our core values of Accountability, Commitment, Excellence, Integrity and Teamwork (ACE-IT!). A comprehensive benefits package is available for full-time regular employees and includes Medical (HDHP) w/Pharmacy, Dental, Vision, Long Term Disability, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Account Options, Life Insurance, Accident Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance, Pre-paid Legal Insurance, Parking and Transit FSA accounts, 401K, ROTH 401K, and paid time off. CorVel is an Equal Opportunity Employer, drug free workplace, and complies with ADA regulations as applicable. #LI-Remote If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

[Hybrid] QA Test Analyst (10410-1) - job post JND 11 reviews Irving, TX Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Apply Here -> https://jnd-inc.breezy.hr/ Position Overview Job Title: QA Test Analyst Job Type: Regular Full-Time, Hourly BA in Business or Statistics or equivalent with 2-5 years of related work experience Location Irving, TX (Tue-Thu in the office) Benefits Health Insurance (Medical, Dental & Vision) 401(k) with Company Match Bonus H1B/Green Card Sponsorship for qualified employee Hands-on experience at global industry leader Samsung Opportunities for career advancement Position Summary The main function of a QA test analyst is to develop and execute software test plans in order to identify software problems and their causes. An entry level QA test analyst will typically run scripts given to them; as they progress, the analyst is responsible for the development of scripts. This analyst position will manage return inventory with determining the root cause of defects to prevent recurrence of the issues and quality problems in Service business. This position will be capable of documenting the processes, generating reporting and providing analysis on defective quality reporting to drive improvement within the business. Top 3 Skills 1. Operation management of UPC (Used Parts Center) 2. RMA lead for MX W/H-RMA stands for Return Material Assessment; MX is the Org Mobile Unit; W/H stands for Warehouse 3. Excel Skills Responsibilities Coordinate with the various organizations within Service group to provide reporting and analysis needs around various data points. Provides training and support to users with regards to reporting tools Define quality attributes, external interfaces, constraints, and other nonfunctional requirements Represent requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or scenarios, where appropriate Organizational skills, to work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information Generate reports and analysis around reporting Background & Experience A Bachelor's Degree in Business or Statistics or equivalent work experience 2-5 years of job related experience Proven capability to analyze data and develop a course of action from the data Proven ability to prioritize projects and meet deadlines Experience working with various production and software Proven ability to manage multiple tasks to resolution Experience in the wireless industry a plus Experience in Project Management a plus Skills & Attributes Demonstrated ability to interact primarily with peers, supervisors, application end user managers, with local and foreign (HQ) IS personnel, and to work cooperatively in a teamwork environmen The ability to occasionally interface with senior management for information exchange Ability to analyze, make judgments, decisions and recommendations for the application of daily functional practices. The ability to apply constructive thinking and imaginative solutions to analyze and give solutions to challenges based on data Ability to communicate professionally both verbally and through written correspondence Ability to explain reports and analysis to all levels of the organization and all skill levels Ability to work for a varied customer base Ability to think analytically and attention to detail Physical & Mental Demands Work is generally performed in an office environment. Operate a computer keyboard and view a video display terminal between 50% - 95% of work time, including prolonged periods of time. Requires considerable (90%+) work utilizing high visual acuity/detail, numeric/character distinction, and moderate hand/finger dexterity. The movement and transportation of equipment, most of the time is under 25 pounds. Performs work under time schedules and stress which are normally periodic or cyclical, including time sensitive deadlines, intellectual challenge, some language barriers and project management deadlines. Machines, tools, equipment and work aids include PCs, printers, copiers, faxes, and other equipment commonly associated with an office work area. May require working additional hours beyond normal schedule. Role requires domestic and international travel 10%-15%. Consistently demonstrates a commitment to policies and procedures, including but not limited to, attendance, confidentiality, conflict of interest and ethical responsibilities. Our team of highly experienced developers offer a wide range of mobile application and software development positions. We also have opportunities in business operations and administrations, logistics, UX/UI design, and many more with our client, Samsung! Our vision is ‘We Want to See You Grow' to become the industry leader for both employee and company. For more information about JND, please visit www.jndsolutions.com If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Quality Assurance Analyst II - job post ARGO Richardson, TX Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time ARGO is a leading provider of software and analytics solutions for both the financial services and healthcare industries. ARGO transforms business processes for financial service providers and healthcare organizations using proven business models and software innovation informed by real customer challenges, breakthrough technology, and rich analytics. The Quality Assurance Analyst II leads, executes, and supports application and system software testing tasks to ensure accuracy, quality and adherence to standards across ARGO’s internal and external SDLC initiatives for our clients. The role entails accountability for providing KPI’s for monitoring processes, enforcing team accountability, and capturing and reporting root cause analytics across the project team for creation of a defect prevention model. The role requires collaboration with both business and technology personnel to comprehend and clarify requirements, formulate comprehensive test strategies, develop input and expected output data, execute and evaluate test results, and support internal and external project testing. This position will be working fully ONSITE at our Richardson, TX location. : QUALIFICATIONS: A Bachelor’s Degree in Management Information Systems (MIS), Computer Science (CS), or in Liberal Arts with SQA certifications from the ASTQB are recommended for the position. 4+ years of professional experience including 2+ years in software testing. REQUIRED SKILLS: Knowledge of and experience with Quality Assurance and Performance Testing methodologies. Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail. Ability to create and execute simple T-SQL queries to insert and query data with MS SQL Server or other major DBMS. Experience installing and configuring complex software systems on MS Windows that include many client-side and server software components communicating over network and WAN. Experience analyzing log and trace files for test validation and troubleshooting. Excellent time management skills, including dedication and planning to achieve validation of software in order to meet required delivery dates. Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to work in a team environment, as well as work independently with minimum supervision. ADDITIONAL PREFERRED SKILLS: Experience with testing techniques such as: pairwise, equivalence partitioning, boundary value analysis, decision tables, cause-effect graphing, state transition testing, defect taxonomies, and other appropriate techniques. Hands on experience using industry standard tools to manage the workflow of testing tasks, such as XRAY or Jira. Experience creating, executing, and modifying automated test execution with testing tools such as Cucumber, Selenium, Ready! API, soapUI Pro, Postman, or other common industry tools. Experience designing and executing controlled performance testing for internal and customer use. Knowledge of Cloud computing services such as Azure (preferred) or AWS. Ability to review and interpret source code (c, c++, c#) to help guide test plans. Knowledge and experience of financial services or healthcare industry software applications. EXPECTED WORK AND PERFORMANCE: The Quality Assurance Analyst will be responsible for the core activities of the testing effort. Job duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned as needed. Knowledge of the value of ARGO’s quality services to increase revenue and deliver value to our customers. Facilitate testing activities to reduce risk, eliminate waste, discover defects, increase confidence in the quality of ARGO software and provide information for project and product decision makers. Conduct test coverage improvements and improve efficiency by leading continuous enhancements to the ARGO test case library using specification-based, defect-based, and experience-based testing techniques. Balance work on multiple projects in various stages simultaneously. Produce test plans, with input from development, product, and project managers, in order to develop and execute test cases that validate the quality of software prior to release to clients. Analyze requirement and design documents for quality, identify gaps and ambiguities, testability, and make recommendations for specification improvement. Acquire knowledge of multiple lines of business and ARGO products. Develop and execute comprehensive test scripts with in depth understanding of data preparation and management to detect defects and execute confirmation tests. Analyze troubleshooting data, and make recommendations on root cause analysis. Acquire knowledge of value and quality from our client’s perspective, and contribute to client testing success, including planning, execution, and problem resolution in UAT and production environments, and effectively communicating results with appropriate parties for resolution. Ability to travel up to 10%. ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Applicants for U.S. or Canadian based positions with ARGO must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available at this time for ARGO positions. Pre-employment background screening will be conducted. If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Testing Tech Lead Analyst (Hybrid) - job post Citi 19,182 reviews Irving, TX $110,890 - $166,340 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $110,890 - $166,340 a year Job Type Full-time Brief Description of the Organization Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Citi’s Personal Banking and Wealth Management (PBWM) division is building a purpose-driven team to serve its globally diverse, digitally forward customers in top cities around the world. We’re looking for exceptional candidates who think digitally and differently, resolve problems in unconventional ways and strive to provide a remarkable experience for our clients. Overview of the Role Citi’s PBWM Technology (PBWMT) organization serves the PBWM global suite of products providing a full range of innovative and comprehensive set of services. Our businesses also offer industry-leading advanced technology, a strong worldwide presence and a powerful global franchise. The Testing Tech Lead Analyst is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family. Responsibilities: Supports Initiatives related to User Acceptance Testing (UAT) process and product rollout into production. Testing specialists who work with technology project managers, UAT professionals and users to design and implement appropriate scripts/plans for an application testing strategy/approach. Plans, conducts and manages a broad range of systems and application testing deliverables for IT projects. Obtains detailed specification from business users and development to ascertain specific output information requirements. Works with other teams to develop integrated methodologies for testing end-to-end transactions in order to ensure that IT Testing is delivering a quality product to users in an established timeframe. Analyzes and communicates test results to project teams; recommends appropriate course of action. Provides accurate and precise estimates for assigned task duration and work effort, along with confidence level, and foreseeable dependencies. Monitors projects on an ongoing basis, evaluating progress and quality, managing risks / issues, and taking corrective action as necessary to meet project deadlines. Has impact on IT testing by influencing decisions through advice, counsel or facilitating services to others. Acts as advisor and mentor for junior members of the team. Resolves a variety of complex issues through evaluative judgment and analytical thought. Exhibits comprehensive knowledge of several areas within IT testing and has a good understanding of the industry. Performs other duties and functions as assigned. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 6-10 years experience in Business Analysis or Systems Analysis Ability to effectively use complex analytical, interpretive and problem solving techniques Requires communication and diplomacy skills to guide, influence and convince others. Ability to organize/manage multiple priorities and projects coupled with the flexibility to adapt to changes in a fast-paced environment Education: Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred - Job Family Group: Technology - Job Family: Technology Quality - Time Type: Full time - Primary Location: Irving Texas United States - Primary Location Salary Range: $110,890.00 - $166,340.00 - Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Quality Analyst/Grand Prairie, TX - job post LOCKHEED MARTIN CORPORATION 9,160 reviews Arlington, TX 76018 Part-time, Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Part-time Full-time Lockheed Martin (LM) is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst in Grand Prairie, TX to support the THAAD Joint Improvement Team (JIT). The JIT is a collaborative and proactive continuous improvement program sharply focused on preventing product escapes, eliminating production line interruptions, and enhancing value chain performance comprised of cross-functional representatives from Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (MFC), Lockheed Martin Space Systems Company (SSC), and our partnering customers. This position will support the LM JIT continuous improvement strategy which leverages input from internal LM cross-functional peers, external supply chain counterparts, functional and site Quality Assurance management personnel and customer representatives. Superior communication and time management skills are essential. As part of the JIT, you will perform process and product assessments, review requirements, hardware, and documentation to ensure our customer gets the highest level of Quality. In a culture of continuous improvement our department utilizes lean initiatives to reduce waste and drive affordability and efficiency. In this role, you will use quality metrics and business analytics tools to monitor the program’s value chain and provide guidance for recommended support or improvement initiatives. The best candidate for this position ensures the conformance to company and regulatory standards. Initiates, reviews, analyzes and reports on quality-related data/metrics from production, service, supplier or process improvement activities and analyzes using statistical techniques. Interfaces as needed with manufacturing, engineering, customer, vendor and subcontractor representatives to ensure process requirements are met. Basic Qualifications: Minimum of a completed bachelors degree Possess excellent verbal and written communications skills for use at all levels of the organization to track production and/or project status Experience with data analysis Currently possess or ability to obtain and maintain a Secret Security Clearance. Ability to support travel (25%) as required. Effective interpersonal and communication skills, including team building and collaboration. Desired Skills: Ability to organize and track multiple activities and prioritize task based on importance. Quality experience Ability to review, interpret and apply specifications to determine compliance with requirements. Effective interpersonal skills, including team building and collaboration. Effective communication skills: written, oral, listening, and presentation Experience with Root Cause Analysis tools. Understanding of Lean Six Sigma tools and processes. Basic understanding of GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerance). ASQ Certified Quality Associate (CQA), Quality Engineer (CQE), Quality Auditor (CQA) Experience in extracting data, developing charts, and reporting metrics Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Clearance Level: Secret Other Important Information You Should Know Expression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Ability to Work Remotely: Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits. Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
